conbody.p: Clients that make service and attribute queries through CSdpAgent must implement the MSdpAgentNotifier interface to handle the responses.

section.title: How to create an object to handle inquiry results
section.p: There are two kinds of results that require handling, they are:
We will examine a simple handling example for both kinds below.

section.title: Handling service search results
section.p: When a service search request completes, it calls the NextRecordRequestComplete():
section.codeblock: virtual void NextRecordRequestComplete(TInt aError, TSdpServRecordHandle aHandle, TInt aTotalRecordsCount)
section.p: aHandle gives the service record handle of the matching service, and can be used in a subsequent attribute query. aTotalRecordsCount gives the total number of matching records.

section.title: Handling attribute read results
section.p: When an attribute request completes, each single attribute is returned with its attribute ID using AttributeRequestResult().
section.codeblock: virtual void AttributeRequestResult(TSdpServRecordHandle aHandle, TSdpAttributeID aAttrID, CSdpAttrValue* aAttrValue)
section.p: The ID of the attribute is given in aAttrID, and the attribute value itself in aAttrValue. You can find the type of the attribute through aAttrValue->Type(), cast aAttrValue on this base to the correct subclass of CSdpAttrValue: for example, if the type is ETypeBoolean, you can cast aAttrValue to a CSdpAttrValueBoolean.
When there are no more attributes to be returned, AttributeRequestComplete() is called.

section.title: Where Next?
section.p: The complete set of Service Discovery Agent tutorials are shown below:

li.p: Handling SDP query results - This document

section.p: Also refer to the Bluetooth Service Discovery Agent Overview and the Bluetooth SDP Overview for additional background information.
